title.narrative: 004 NUTRITION AND EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: TG Technical Assistance to regional and federal Emergency Nutrition Coordination Units/DRMFSS, which contributes to Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Project Support - Non-Salary

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: TG Technical Assistance to regional and federal Emergency Nutrition Coordination Units/DRMFSS

description.narrative: Impact of El Ni?o persists, and humanitarian and nutrition needs remained elevated, with admissions to the Targeted Feeding Programme (TFP) in the period marking the highest in the history of Ethiopia's CMAM programme in the country. UNICEF supported nutrition cluster coordination by Emergency Nutrition Coordination Unit (ENCU). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2016

title.narrative: Number of multi-sectoral early warning bulletins produced at federal and regional levels /per year

actual.value: 2016:6 The National Disaster Risk Management Commission (NDRMC) and regional Disaster Prevention and Preparedness Bureaus (DPPBs) publish monthly early warning bulletin that contains situation update on the nutrition and health, water, food security, and market and also takes stock of ongoing response.

title.narrative: Number of national and regional emergency nutrition coordination meetings held/per year
Number of woredas with SMART surveys undertaken supported by UNICEF technical assistance

actual.value: 2016:21 done in Dec 2015-Jan 2016 round, Jun-Jul 2016 round will be replaced by coverage surveysFirst round of biannual nutrition surveys using SMART methodology were undertaken in December-January 2016, results of which show the nutrition status of children is at serious to critical levels in 57% of t

title.narrative: Percent of emergency priority 1 woredas in which Outpatient Therapeutic Feeding (OTP)units are established/strengthened within 4 weeks of priority classification
